content: Which famous English playwright wrote tragedies such as 'Macbeth', 'Hamlet', and 'Othello'?

Ah, that would be William Shakespeare. He's often referred to as the Bard of Avon and is considered one of the greatest writers in the English language. His works, including those tragedies you mentioned, have been performed countless times all over the world and have had a profound influence on literature and drama.
